formattedAddress: 2494 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10033, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2494 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10033-3326, USA

originalText.text: Awesome clean place. Great ownership and are willing to work with you. Ldnuant rules and they just expect yiu to take care. Of this place as if it's yours in thr long run. Hours are reasonable and cleanliness determines by floors and apartment roomate. Cleaning service is avialiable and garbage takeout is daily and a plus. Plus concierge security service for peace of mind and safety among lonely nights. All appliances work and apartment super is always avialiable for maintenance calls.. Heat is always on and water is always heated. Perfect. Couldn't ask for much.

originalText.text:
The staff confuses social services with the criminal justice system. Homelessness is not a criminal justice issue, and no one living in a homeless shelter should face unprovoked threats of physical harm by thugs on staff. Staff in such a facility should not only NOT instigate unprovoked threats on residents (including threats to find residents after working hours off premises in order to avoid reprimand for such behavior), they should in fact be trained in DEescalation communication techniques and should be screened so that individuals with anger management issues do not find themselves in positions where they might abuse the power they perceive they have been given over the residents.

Once, when threatened by a staff member as I simply walked to the bathroom, I asked point blank, "Do you think it's appropriate for you to speak to me that way?" The question was met with "This is not a country club."

"It's also not a prison," I replied, shocked that the default attitude is one of a warden to an inmate.

People in need of the services of a shelter deserve better than this race to the lowest level possible.

originalText.text: About as good as you'd expect a shelter to be
